comment: I loved having Dr. Fowler as my professor. I was very sad to see him leave : ( His classes are challenging but that makes it more interesting. His tests are essay but most history classes are especially upper level classes. I recomend his classes to anyone who wants to learn something and remember it.

Had him for World War II in the summer, and IMO he is the best KSU prof I have encountered thus far.  Unfortunately he won't be teaching at KSU anymore.  Lots of reading, great class discussions, lots of film, tests are all essay based.  You will learn more than you probably originally anticipate, but well worth the time and effort.

I had him for WWII, summer. Lots of reading and essays, but nothing too hard, given that this is a senior level class. Lots of discussion, he is very knowlegable, interesting, laid back. Keeps his politics out of the classroom. Class is very well balanced btw films, discussion, reading. Let us choose our questions for tests. Very sad to see him go.
thinks hes god. he isnt. he has far too high an opinion of himself. groupies.
thinks he's god. he's not.

He definitely makes you work for your grade, but he makes the class really enjoyable. I had him for Civil War & Reconstruction and it was difficult. There is a considerable amount of writing, but nothing outrageous as it was an upper-level history class. As long as you're willing to put in the effort you'll be rewarded. FYI I got an A so I'm happy.
great class because you do not have to be there. Hands out the notes at beggining of each class. Test are straight off the notes. I went to one lecture class and still got a B.

A lot of work, but he makes you learn. Class is fun, bond with classmates. He doesn't play favrites! Sometimes brings in food, like at haloween or birthdays. read, THESIS! Reminds me of Peter O'Tool in that movie, very serious, but makes students love him. I wuold take him again.

I don't understand all the comments about how hard Fowler is. He's not really hard at all. Grades easy, if you know how to write a coherent sentence and identify the author's thesis. I guess these students want to be at a community college where they only have to read 6 or 7 books in each class. KSU is a UNIVERSITY now, people. WAKE UP!!

Because of him I have a deeper love of History. I would recommend him to any and every student. Be prepared for a lot of reading and research, and always be prepared to defend your arguement. He is funny, intelligent, and fair. I hope he teaches other classes in the future.

Wonderful Professor!  I am a senior and history major, and I have taken 5 classes from Dr. Fowler.  He expects a lot of you...  keep up with the readings!  You should be on  time for his class... no exceptions. Very nice person... willing to help when you need it.  EXTREMELY fair professor.  If you are serious about history take his class!
Class on Third Reich.  They expect alot and you learn alot,  class very entertaining and interesting

i took 2 classes with him he is awsome! it made me love history, i love how he challenges you, if you read and listen to him, you will do good, i got an A in both classes and i am not a history major, i wouldn't recommend him if you don't like to learn, and challenge yourself. but your in college so why not learn something! definetly excellent teac
He expects you to work, but he is a great teacher.  He knows his stuff and has a great sense of humor.  If you take him, expect to be challenged.  You will not pass unless you read and participate.

If I had the time I would take every class that Dr. Fowler teaches.  He is the hardest history prof. at KSU, but also the best.  If you love history and want to excel in the field take Dr. Fowler. If you are a busy adult, trying to "just get through," then he is not for you.
WOW!!  He is not an easy teacher!!  The classes are very interesting, though.  There is too much reading though!

I am a better person because of Dr. Fowler... he challenges you and pushes you and makes you earn an A, which I am happy to say I recieved in his class.  He is willing to go the extra mile to help you out in whatever capacity needed to better your experience in his class.
Hard. Will make you work your grade. Smart, funny, and helpful. Most rewarding class that I have had to date. Lots of reading and writing, but what history class isn't.

Excellent professor.  Loved the class.  However, he expects you to read and work hard.  Very knowledgable on topic.  Definitely recommend this professor.  He's funny, interesting, and loves the subject.

Excellent teacher, excellent lechture, horrible tested.  All tests essay, all very difficult and based on both book specifics and lechture specifics.  If you do not stay up on the readings you fail.  Three moderate sized book reports and papers, All must be  viewed by writting lab prior to turn in .

I learned more from Dr. Fowler then any history teacher I have ever had.  His lectures are very well organized and he is very knowledgeable on what he teaches.  He also gives extremely good advice for history majors and sets a high example for others to f
He is a nice person but a horrible teacher.  If you are a history major I reccommend taking him, if not, find another teacher!
great teacher. he is also my advisor and is always willing to help.
